intro: Halimocnemis occidentalis, commonly known as the western sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink to purple, typically blooming in spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Halimocnemis occidentalis is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
